summary: This document is an email chain between an FBI Special Agent and American Airlines Corporate Security regarding a Federal Grand Jury subpoena for travel records related to Ghislaine Maxwell. The FBI requests expedited production of passenger reservation records, ticket copies, and usage information, citing a child exploitation/human trafficking investigation and instructs the airline not to notify the subscriber.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subpoena and attached records are specifically related to her travel on American Airlines as part of a child exploitation/human trafficking investigation.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: The FBI agent from New York who sent the initial subpoena request to American Airlines Corporate Security on January 28, 2020, regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell investigation.

persons.name: Analyst
persons.context: The American Airlines analyst who responded to the FBI's subpoena, attaching the requested travel records for Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: The FBI Special Agent is investigating Ghislaine Maxwell as part of a federal grand jury subpoena for her travel records in a child exploitation/human trafficking matter.
The American Airlines analyst is the custodian of travel records for Ghislaine Maxwell and provided them to the FBI in response to the subpoena.
The FBI Special Agent issued the subpoena to American Airlines Corporate Security, and the Analyst responded by providing the requested travel records.

events.title: FBI Issues Grand Jury Subpoena to American Airlines
events.description: An FBI Special Agent from New York sends a Federal Grand Jury subpoena to American Airlines Corporate Security, requesting travel records for Ghislaine Maxwell related to a child exploitation/human trafficking investigation.

events.title: American Airlines Provides Travel Records
events.description: An American Airlines Revenue Fraud Corporate Security Analyst responds to the FBI subpoena, attaching passenger reservation records, ticket copies, and ticket usage information for Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Expedited Subpoena Due Date
events.description: The FBI's subpoena to American Airlines had an expedited due date of February 7, 2020, for the production of records.

keyFacts: The FBI issued a Federal Grand Jury subpoena to American Airlines for travel records specifically related to Ghislaine Maxwell.
The investigation is explicitly described as a 'child exploitation/human trafficking matter'.
The FBI requested expedited service by February 7, 2020, and instructed American Airlines not to notify the subscriber (likely Ghislaine Maxwell or an associate).
The records produced included passenger reservation records, ticket copies, and ticket usage information from American Airlines.
The correspondence demonstrates active federal investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell's travel activities as of early 2020.
